DataElement.preferredName: Progressive Disease Prior Therapeutic Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow a person to participate in a clinical trial that are related to disease progression prior to administration of therapeutic agents.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Progressive Disease Prior Therapeutic Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity._Earlier in time or order._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Cancer that is increasing in scope or severity.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

Property.preferredName: Prior Therapeutic Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient had clinical or r
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had clinical or radiographic progression on prior anti-EGFR antibody therapy (either panitumumab or cetuximab?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient progressed on prior treatment with a checkpoint inhibitor (PD-1/PD-L1 inhibitors) either as a single-agent therapy or in combination, as shown with the following: Patients who have progressed after receiving a checkpoint inhibitor in combination with a platinum-based doublet, as first-line treatment for NSCLC or Patients who have progressed on checkpoint inhibitor as second-line therapy, after receiving a platinum-based doublet as first-line therapy or Patients who have progressed on platinum-based doublet as second-line therapy, after receiving a checkpoint inhibitor as first-line therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had progressive disease on prior EGFR inhibitor therapy (gefitinib, erlotinib, afatinib or osimertinib)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 100
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have progressive or recurrent LGG?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient progressed on at least one and not more than five prior chemotherapy regimens, including in the neoadjuvant, adjuvant, and metastatic settings?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has prostate cancer and receiving treatment with gonadotropin-releasing hormone( GnRH)  agonists, is there evidence of disease progression on prior therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: If enrolled in the Expansion Cohort, has patient had progressive disease on prior first line EGFR inhibitor therapy with Osimertinib?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient have disease progression on or after 5-FU-based therapy for metastatic or unresectable PDAC?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient progressed after at least one prior systemic treatment for incurable advanced or metastatic disease?
